1321.question: How big is performance improvement proposed methods are used?
1321.response:
The performance improvement when using the proposed methods can be assessed by looking at the accuracy over clean and adversarial test sets presented in Image 2. 

The baseline model's performance on clean accuracy is 87.1%, while the most improved model ("Adv logit + Clean logit + Data augmentation (cs+es)") has a clean accuracy of 82.9%. However, this isn't the full picture, as we also need to account for the adversarial accuracy.

For adversarial accuracy against 'cs' attacks, the baseline model achieves 28.4%, while the aforementioned most improved model shows a significant increase to 42
1321.answer:
Data augmentation (es)  improved Adv es by 20% comparing to baseline 
Data augmentation (cs) improved Adv cs by 16.5% comparing to baseline
Data augmentation (cs+es) improved both Adv cs and Adv es by at least 10% comparing to baseline 
All models show improvements over adversarial sets
